Name: EventDefinition
Description: A description of when an event can occur+ Warning: Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generationElements defined in Ancestors: id, meta, implicitRules, language, text, contained, extension, modifierExtension

Name: url
Description: Canonical identifier for this event definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)

Name: identifier
Description: Additional identifier for the event definition

Name: version
Description: Business version of the event definition

Name: name
Description: Name for this event definition (computer friendly)

Name: title
Description: Name for this event definition (human friendly)

Name: subtitle
Description: Subordinate title of the event definition

Name: status
Description: draft | active | retired | unknownPublicationStatus (Required)

Name: experimental
Description: For testing purposes, not real usage

Name: subjectCodeableconcept
Description: Type of individual the event definition is focused onSubject type (Extensible)

Name: subjectReference(group)
Description: Type of individual the event definition is focused onSubject type (Extensible)

Name: date
Description: Date last changed

Name: publisher
Description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)

Name: contact
Description: Contact details for the publisher

Name: description
Description: Natural language description of the event definition

Name: useContext
Description: The context that the content is intended to support

Name: jurisdiction
Description: Intended jurisdiction for event definition (if applicable)Jurisdiction (Extensible)

Name: purpose
Description: Why this event definition is defined

Name: usage
Description: Describes the clinical usage of the event definition

Name: copyright
Description: Use and/or publishing restrictions

Name: approvalDate
Description: When the event definition was approved by publisher

Name: lastReviewDate
Description: When the event definition was last reviewed

Name: effectivePeriod
Description: When the event definition is expected to be used

Name: topic
Description: E.g. Education, Treatment, Assessment, etc.DefinitionTopic (Example)

Name: author
Description: Who authored the content

Name: editor
Description: Who edited the content

Name: reviewer
Description: Who reviewed the content

Name: endorser
Description: Who endorsed the content

Name: relatedArtifact
Description: Additional documentation, citations, etc.

Name: trigger
Description: "when" the event occurs (multiple = 'or')
